document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Pholcus (Araneae: Pholcidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the genus Pholcus (Araneae: Pholcidae) from China

heading.emphasis:
Key to Chinese species of
Pholcus

paragraph.keyLead:
- AME reduced to pigment specks; each eye triad on a longer eye-stalk ( Figs. 39A–B ) ..................
P. podophthalmus
3 Male palpal cymbium with a conical projection and tarsal organ near tip of projection ............................................. 4
- Male palpal cymbium without conical projection; tarsal organ on cymbium ............................................................. 6

4 Uncus of genital bulb helmet-like ( Fig. 14I ); epigynum with short club-shaped apophysis
................................ P. gui

5 Appendix of genital bulb with two thorn-shaped projections centrally ( Figs. 4E–F ); epigynum with nearly rectangular pore plates ( Fig. 4C )
................................................................................................................ P. bidentatus

- Appendix of genital bulb without such projections; epigynum with shoe-shaped pore plates ( Fig. 21B ) .........
P. kimi
7 Male chelicerae with pair of distal apophyses and proximolateral apophyses ............................................................ 8
- Male chelicerae with pair of distal apophyses, proximolateral apophyses and proximocentral apophyses .............. 19

9 Male eye triad on a relatively long eye-stalk ( Fig. 27C ); epigynum roughly bell-shaped ( Fig. 27A )............
P. medog

- Male eye triad on a slightly elevated tubercle; epigynum roughly broadly triangular ( Fig. 55B )..............
P. wuyiensis
10 Male genital bulb without appendix or with reduced appendix; epigynum with knob-shaped apophysis ................. 11
- Male genital bulb with distinct appendix; epigynum with long whip-shaped or necktie-shaped apophysis ............. 13
- Male palpal trochanter with long ventral apophysis; epigynum with oval pore plates............................................... 12

keyLead.keyStep:
12 Male genital bulb without appendix ( Fig. 2G ); epigynum with small T-shaped apophysis ( Fig. 2C )
.. P. beijingensis

paragraph.keyLead: 13 Male genital bulb with axe-shaped or boot-shaped uncus; epigynum with necktie-shaped apophysis ..................... 14
- Male genital bulb with W-shaped or S-shaped uncus; epigynum with whip-shaped apophysis ............................... 15
- Male genital bulb with W-shaped uncus; epigynum with oval pore plates ................................................................ 16

18 Appendix of genital bulb hooked ( Fig. 32H ); pore plates of epigynum relatively close ( Fig. 32B )
....... P. paralinzhou
19 Male genital bulb without appendix; epigynum with small nipple-shaped apophysis .............................................. 20
- Male genital bulb with distinct appendix; epigynum with necktie-, knob- or club-shaped apophysis ...................... 28
20. Male palpal trochanter width equal to or more than half as long as palpal femur .................................................... 21
- Male palpal trochanter width distinctly less than half as long as palpal femur ......................................................... 22

23 Male palpal procursus with hook-shaped projection on tip and long forked-tongue-shaped apophysis near tip ( Fig. 24G ); epigynum with kidney-shaped pore plates ( Fig. 24C ).....................................................................
P. lingulatus
24 Tip of proximolateral apophyses of male chelicerae sightly biforked ...................................................................... 25
- Tip of proximolateral apophyses of male chelicerae not biforked ............................................................................ 26
26 Tip of male palpal procursus pointed, with distinct spine-shaped apophysis ............................................................. 27

- Tip of male palpal procursus not pointed, with several apophyses ( Fig. 6G )
..................................... P. clavimaculatus
- Male palpal femur with dorsal projection retrolaterally ( Figs. 47G , 56I and 62G ) ................................................... 32

keyLead.keyStep: 30 Male palpal trochanter width equal to or more than half as long as palpal femur; epigynum with necktie- or short club-shaped apophysis ............................................................................................................................................... 31
